title: Just had the pleasure of playing with an Inting Sion
body:
We won the game because he kept inting into towers while we took objectives. He ended the game by inting into the nexus. Lmao, it feels dirty.
Working as INTended?

https://i.imgur.com/vaL29J7.png[]

replies.body: It is a dumb strategy that is niche.

It is also entirely reliant on your teammates actually doing something with the pressure.

Really it's just super advanced split pushing, but the problem with split pushing in solo Q - ESPECIALLY IN LOWER TIERS - is the team has to be able to play around it, or you have to be uber fed to the point that strategy is thrown out the window because you are unkillable.

Literally had a game yesterday where our Jax got 6 early kills then wanted to group mid vs a team with Veigar.

He was completely useless because he could never engage. I tried to get him to split push but he was dead set on 5v5s.

Stuff like that, not recognising team composition win conditions, being dead set on 5v5 as the only way to win a game (huge problems in low elo), on top of the fact that the "strat" means sions team will almost always be in a group of 4 at the most, it limits the plays that can be made.

This all leaves inting sion in a weird place

"Group mid"
\- Bronze

Yes, group mid, that's how to win this game..

Assassins actually intend to help the team though between those kills. Every Int Sion I've ever seen has completely ignored every team fight, completely fed the top lane in the process, and refuses ever to leave the lane for Dragon. 

The amount of times I've heard "I'm int Sion, I don't leave lane" is insane.

_______________

-Refusing to communicate? Check
-Refusing to work with the team? Check
-intentionally feeding? Check
-Assisting enemy team? Check

...and it's a wonder why the report system keeps flagging them on multiple offenses. I'll keep getting them banned though :).

Brightside gold changes are incoming next season to make this strategy useless. I'm going to be so happy when people still have gold value even when having no kills.

So?  I've heard literally the same thing from Nasus mains since 2010.  Can't help dragon too busy getting mad stakz.  Same with exh support singed a while back too.   You can still make the argument that they are playing to win, even if their strategies are abusing mechanics and pissing off their teammates to do so.

Fix the mechanics, don't ban the player.

>You can still make the argument that they are playing to win, even if their strategies are abusing mechanics and pissing off their teammates to do so.
> 
> Fix the mechanics, don't ban the player.

They are fixing the mechanics, but sadly worlds are going on right now - so we have to wait until Pre-season for a fix. There is already a plan for Sion in the works with gold value changes.

Let's use support singed for an example. Where a player had full intention to win games, but he was banned based off "refusing to communicate with team" and "refusing to work with team." It caused such a toxic environment for everyone he qued with that it was put to a stop. That player had full intention to win.

>I understand you want to play Singed Support, however, your teammates do not want you to play Singed Support"

Basically, if you set up a situation where you hold the game hostage and refuse to do anything but your own strategy, especially when it involves ignoring four other players - there are grounds for removal.

Riot's only putting up with this strategy temporary because a fix is too far away. End of the day though it still breaks all current rules in place, and falls in line with past offenses. 

Why are people getting banned?...because the report system was designed to prevent the majority of what this strategy promotes. If you have to break multiple rules to play - yah the systems going to pick yah up.

By that same logic, how about a one trick player?  Maybe others on a team -really- don't like the champ you want to play and you were autofilled in an off-meta role (shaco teemo yasuo etc)?  Is that grounds for removal, even though you're giving your team the best chance at winning by playing your best char, albeit in an offbeat position?

It's alright to pick an off meta champion and it's alright to play a position weird.

What's not ok is completely ignoring the rest of the game for your own vision of what the game should be. 

If I play jungle, and AFK farm all game without even entering lane once - am I playing my position right? am I being a positive experience for the rest of my team? Even if somewhere you do intend to win down the line, you're still holding the game hostage and causing a negative experience for someone else.

If your goal is to completely ignore everyone else, just play a single player game. 

My entire point is Sion provides a negative experience to most team-mates when he does this. He has to break multiple rules to accomplish this goal, and that's toxic for the game health. Off meta champs are not even close to what he does.

Actually no, Assassins who are behind and stupidly jump into the bacline to snag a kill when theyre several levels below the enemy is still inting and reportable just as much as inting sion.
A good assassing would realise that he's behind, farm it up, and clean up teamfights instead of starting them and get killed.
As with all gimmick strats it depends heavily on people not really understanding how to deal with it rather then being universally strong. Like no ADC bot. Or classic singed proxy.
I have only seen it once. It ended in our top Jax getting fed and just destroying everything. In my case, the inting Sion only managed to do the inting part.

My issue with it is people don't know how to play it. If you win lane as sion, you do the same thing but without dying. it's meant to be something you swap into when your losing not something you do at the start of the game.
DO NOT PLAY THIS INTO A FIORA OR RIVEN. THAT IS ALL.

I don't like playing against it since it's hard to coordinate mapwide plays in solo queue with limited communication.  Even I have failed to see his pushes and have lost a game to him pushing in and getting a ziggs to tp with him for massive objective damage.

It's a good strat but I ban that shit.
